page.title: 13Richmond Cemetery
page.content: THE cemetery covers four acres,the number of graves they have is 4,000 to 5,000.In the cemetery not all of the graves have tomb stones. The undertaker provides the coffins and buries them 6 to 8 feet. The cemetery has different parts for different religions. Animals are not allowed to be buried there. The church in the cemetery is made out of stone and wood. People are brought from all over the area to be buried. The most expensive tomb stone is Â£125.00. The cemetery was first used in 1886 when the graveyard of the parish church of St Mary's was full up. The cemetery is very neat and tidy, David who is in charge of it used to be a gardener
